classitems.description:
Scans the description text for instances of markdown code blocks flagged as 'glimmer' syntax. If any such instances are found, they are copied, stripped of their triple backticks and re-inserted into the templateString immediately after the original declaration. This allows for functional copies of your code examples to be automatically rendered into the description, without having to duplicate the code block itself.

If your functional code needs to have different setup to work correctly in the Fountainhead context (for example, if you need to use core-state to set up sandboxed state and controls), simply use 'handlebars' or no syntax flag, and manually add the code block you want Fountainhead to render after your example. Neato!
classitems.name: _renderCodeBlocks

params.name: description
params.description: The description text to scan for code blocks

return.description: HTML string parsed from passed markdown
